topics.body:
FUCK YEAH!

I know I keep talking about gay marriage, but more good news: anti-gay marriage from republicans in the effected states is completely dropped entirely.  Basically what is happening is that the second the supreme court ruled to reject the appeals it the anti-glbt platform of the republicans in the effected states went poof instantly.

What does this mean?  Chances are there will never be a successful attempt at repealing gay marriage.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@QuasarNova":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54333a5e6368727b2f9e0100#post_54333a5e6368727b2f9e0100
[bq="QuasarNova"]"@SeraphimDawn":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5433390f63687232bbd60000#post_5433390f63687232bbd60000

uc already mentioned it.

Republicans aren't winning the next election, and probably the next 3 since most of it's members are white headed mummies.[/bq]
Correction: the most likely outcomes of the 2014 election are 49republicans-51democracts/50republicans-50democrats/51republicans-49republicans.  Even if they do win control of the senate we're literally talking about by one senate seat.

Downside: if you think this congress is a do nothing congress chances are the next congress will be to the point they can't get anything other than a budget passed.

2016-2024: Social conservatism is going to die hard because in the long run social conservatives are no longer electable.  Chances are 2024 republican party will be completely comprised of libertarians.  2016 and 2020 elections they will in all probability lose hard; 2024 is depends on if they just become a libertarian party or if they still try to cling onto social conservatism.

Tl:dr; social conservatism in the long run will no longer be viable in elections so republicans will have to either become libertarian or die as a party.


I'm not joking either; the only part of the republican party that can ever get potentially get elected anymore is libertarians.  Social conservatives, the religious right and all those other groups have 0% chance of ever going to the white house again.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

I fear this would leave the Democrats politically unchallenged if the Republicans keep suffering losses like this. And I can see the left-wingers already bullying the populace.

topics.body:
"@SeraphimDawn":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5433390f63687232bbd60000#post_5433390f63687232bbd60000
Anti-same sex marriage sentiments are dying a slow, painful death among conservatives. At very least most are learning that they've lost and a lot of hardliners are seen mostly as an embarrassment.

Sometime soon I expect a massive shift among conservatives, similar to what happened in the 80s.

My best case scenario is a massive swell in libertarianism as people who are right wing on spending become disgusted with "family values" and warmongering among republicans.
topics.author: 4f41ee04945b701c41002af7

It depends really.

If republicans refuse to drop social conservatism: RIP republicans, say hello to another era of good feeling(basically for ten years in the usa after the whig party died there was a era in which there was only one political party).

If republicans drop social conservatism: they become a libertarian party instead.

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54333f426368725370d20000#post_54333f426368725370d20000
I take issue with some libertarians who frame freedom as a means to an end, basically the claim that an absolutely free market will create some sort of a utopia.

My view is that freedom is the end in and of itself and I'll still argue it to my last bitter breath regardless of anything else.

Still, if it gets the truly, deeply hateful parts of conservatism excised I'll be as happy as the cat that ate the canary.
